page.title: 02OLD & NEW IN PULBOROUGH.
page.content: The A29 road through Pulborough follows the old Roman Stane Street, going from London to Chichester. A causeway, still used, took the road across the river marshes. Two bridges cross the river at Swan Corner, a new bridge and old disused stone bridge built in 1738 to replace a wooden bridge. There are many old houses. A hump of ground called The Moat was the site of the old manor house, burnt down about 1200. New Place Manor was built of stone nearby, in 1252 A.D. Part of this old house is left with a big inglenook fire place with little stools in it. It has a very old 16th century dove cote, now without doves. Old Place, near the church, is an old manor house, built about 1450, with a medieval hall and a fish pond. 16th. century Old Cottage on Church Hill was possibly once used by smugglers.
